title: How did the invention of paper money impact the world? - Quora

response.answer_text: Paper money changed how the poulation viewed money. It started in the Medevil ages the money lenders started issuing IOUs. These IOUs allowed the lenders to expand thier usable money pool. This money could be invested by giving out more loans or direct investment. This of course made some very powerful men who could control kings. Paper money no longer requires a physical precence of valuable metals. Even more significant as the world moved off the gold standard. Paper is lighter, requres less volume for stated worth, translating into better costs of transporting storage and guarding. I believe that paper mone had to happen to get popoulation to the point where they could accept ecommerce. Can you imagine convincing a merchant “Send me X, your gold is coming”?

For England it was beneficial. In 1694 the Bank of England was founded. It financed the Royal Navy at 8% interest. Depositors would go to the Bank and drop off gold coins like guineas in exchange for Bank of England notes. Pretty soon shopkeepers accepted BOE notes instead of guineas.
